Name.label: Primary bone dysplasia with increased bone density
Syndrome with a cerebellar malformation as major feature
Genetic syndrome with a cerebellar malformation as major feature

TextSection.Contents: Endosteal sclerosis-cerebellar hypoplasia syndrome is characterized by congenital cerebellar hypoplasia, endosteal sclerosis, hypotonia, ataxia, mild to moderate developmental delay, short stature, hip dislocation, and tooth eruption disturbances. It has been described in four patients. Less common manifestations are microcephaly, strabismus, nystagmus, optic atrophy, and dysarthria. It is appears to be transmitted as an autosomal recessive trait.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
